description: This is an introductory course on contemporary philosophy of science. It will cover three central topics within philosophy of science: 1) the demarcation problem, 2) scientific inference and explanation, 3) scientific realism. The last few classes of the course are more inter(sub)disciplinary in nature. They are dedicated to topics on the relationship between science and other aspects of human life, such as public knowledge, feminism, and religious belief.
title: Central Themes in Philosophy of Science
